name: ALU Loma Viloma Prakriya (Anulom Vilom)
benefits: Calms the mind and nervous system
Enhances lung capacity and strengthens breathing muscles
Balances energy channels (Ida and Pingala nadis)
Quiets the mind and improves mental clarity
Greater sense of calm, balance, and vitality
setup: Sit in Sukhasana (easy pose), Padmasana (lotus pose), or any other posture that allows you to sit with a straight spine
Use your right hand to form the Nasagra mudra (thumb and index finger gently touching the tip of your nose)
steps: Close your right nostril with your thumb and inhale deeply through your left nostril
Close both nostrils, hold your breath briefly
Release your right nostril and exhale slowly through it
Hold your breath with both nostrils closed
contraindications: Avoid if experiencing severe nasal congestion
Stop if you feel dizzy or lightheaded
additional_info: Also known as Alternate Nostril Breathing, this practice is believed to promote physical and mental well-being by balancing energy channels, improving respiratory function, and reducing stress.

dosha_information.vata: Excellent for calming excess Vata and reducing anxiety
dosha_information.pitta: Helps balance Pitta by cooling and calming the nervous system
dosha_information.kapha: Can help activate and energize sluggish Kapha energy

guna_information.sattva: Promotes Sattvic qualities of balance and clarity
guna_information.rajas: Calms excessive Rajasic energy and restlessness
guna_information.tamas: Helps overcome Tamasic lethargy through gentle activation

kumbaka: Brief retention with both nostrils closed
ratio_info: Natural rhythm, can progress to 1:1:1:1 ratio
